intro: Triachyrum stachydanthum, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and showy, pale yellow to orange flowers. It is often found in wetlands and along riverbanks, where it thrives in moist, nutrient-rich soils. Due to its rapid growth and ability to spread, it can become invasive in some ecosystems.
